text: my name is Joan Nathan and recently I
went to India to search for Jewish food
for the New York Times I'd read about it
for years and years and I'd always
wanted to go to coach in the first night
which was the last night of Hanukkah
to our surprise we stumbled on a
restaurant called the menorah restaurant
we went in and we heard people singing
Hanukkah songs which shocked us the next
day we went to visit a woman named
Queenie kotor alegre and she lives in a
place called jew town queeny's family
came from iraq her food might be called
a Jewish Iraqi Indian fusion but she's
very well-known for her pastels which of
course came from her Iraqi ancestry but
she's making them with an Indian filling
the next day we went to another market
about an hour away you know it's
wonderful for me as a food writer to see
all the fabulous produce that was
presented there in the middle of the
winter of our winter and then all of a
sudden we walked into this fish store
somebody said this used to be the sunday
school of a synagogue and then we walked
to the next room and there is this
beautiful old synagogue I was able to
walk around this village and realize
what the first Jews did when they came
in search of King Solomon's spices that
he wanted for his temple
